title: How do I balance privacy and usability when running a small business website?
content:
Hey all, I run a small business website (desert safari tours), and I’m trying to make it more privacy-friendly for visitors. I don’t use Google Analytics anymore, and I’m looking at alternatives like Plausible or Matomo.

But I’m stuck on a few things—like how to handle contact forms, booking details, and basic tracking without giving up too much usability or legal compliance (especially with GDPR or similar rules).

What tools or tips do you recommend for someone trying to respect user privacy while still running an effective website?

Thanks in advance!
creator: ishaqsafwah

title: Vertical tabs panel stays expanded when mouse cursor leaves current display
content: I have Firefox configured with auto-expanding vertical tabs. Sometimes, when the mouse cursor leaves the Firefox window through the same border where the tab bar is located, the tab bar expands and stays in that state until the cursor returns to the Firefox window. title: Top of home screen constantly changes back and forth between grey and normal color
content: Hello Last year, I first saw the icons in the far right top corner of home page (red 'X' and other orange one) kept turning grey. Now for several months the entire top 'task bar' area of Firefox home page constantly turns grey, then back to regular color, back and forth, in the most aggravating way. I tried all suggestions: disabled hardware accelerations, disabled themes and extensions, cleared cache.... Still persists. title: Accessibility Issue: VoiceOver & Screen Reader Not Reading Code Elements Properly
content:
Hi Mozilla Support,

I rely heavily on screen readers (specifically VoiceOver on Mac) while browsing and working with developer tools. Recently, I noticed that when inspecting certain pages or downloading developer utilities like Fluxus Executor APK (used for scripting in Roblox), the screen reader doesn’t clearly read out links, buttons, or code blocks properly in Firefox.

Other browsers seem to provide better narration for preformatted code, labels, and actionable items. Is there a way to optimize or enable better accessibility support for developers who use assistive tech in Firefox?

Fluxus Executor is part of my dev testing routine, so accessibility while browsing trusted dev resources is important for my workflow.

Appreciate your support — any tips or settings you recommend?

Thanks!

title: How does sync prioritize different versions of my password data on different devices?
content:
A new Mac App I bought called "CleanMyMac" deleted all my Firefox passwords on my Mac, which was not my intention. (And shame on CleanMyMac for not putting up a warning message.) I didn't want that accidental deletion to be spread to my various iOS devices (causing me to lose passwords there too) so I have turned off Sync for now. I have since recreated my passwords on my Mac (and exported them to a file for backup) and want to resume Syncing. What can I do to ensure that when I turn Sync back on the newly created Password data on my Mac gets priority over the older (now obsolete) password data on my iOS devices?

In other words, I want the passwords on my Mac to replace (via Sync) the obsolete passwords on my iOS devices.

Is there are way to tell Firefox which version should have priority? It was a huge amount of work to recreate all my passwords and logins.

Thanks!
creator: toddphi
